info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued June 07 at 3:39PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT... Localized areas of unhealthy air quality will continue for areas mainly to the east and southeast of the Black fire in the Gila National Forest, which continues to grow along its southern periphery. Near surface smoke will be transported toward the east- northeast this afternoon and into the evening. A decoupling of winds tonight will allow residual smoke to settle into portions of the Mimbres and lower Rio Grande valleys and drift toward the south or southeast or down valley overnight into Wednesday morning. Developing east and southeasterly winds will begin to push new and residual smoke toward the west or northwest beginning midday or early afternoon Wednesday. As a result, smoke transport will become increasingly complex and changeable during the next 24 hours. * WHERE... Near-surface impacts will be most significant and widespread in far southeast Catron, northeast Grant, and much western Sierra counties. This includes Kingston, Hillsboro, and the I-25 corridor from near Elephant Butte and Truth or Consequences to Caballo. Smoke may also expand as far south as Hatch and Radium Springs. More details and latest air quality information can be found at https://fire.airnow.gov * WHEN... Remainder of this afternoon through at least 1pm MDT Wednesday, June 8th. The New Mexico Departments of Health and Environment has issued an Air Quality Alert, until 1 PM MDT Wednesday. An Air Quality Alert for Smoke has been issued.
